body.name: Christmas in the Scottish Highlands: A heart-warming feel-good Christmas romance to fall in love with
body.description: Welcome to the gorgeous little Scottish village of Christmas, where snow is falling, presents are being wrapped and the locals are writing their festive wish lists. Will this finally be the year that Belle’s dreams come true?Thirty-year-old Belle Albany is feeling lonely this Christmas. Another whole year has passed and her life is… exactly the same as it was last December. She longs for true love and a little bit of winter magic – but she’s almost given up on finding it in the sleepy Scottish community where she lives…When Belle crashes into elderly Edina on her cherry red bicycle, it’s not the meet-cute she’d been hoping for. But she immediately recognises the lost look in Edina’s watery-blue eyes and resolves to organise a Christmas to remember for them both – brimming with mince pies, mulled wine and lots of sparkle. Although Belle hadn’t counted on Edina’s home being a crumbling Scottish castle and she certainly hadn’t been expecting Edina’s handsome long-lost grandson Jack Hamilton-Kirk to turn up on the doorstep in the middle of a snow storm…Jack is arrogant, rude and bossy and Belle is convinced he’s about to ruin the seasonal cheer she has worked hard to create. He’s basically the Grinch in human form, so why does her heart race every time they’re in the same room? They disagree on almost everything, from menu choices to music, and yet she starts to glimpse a softer side hidden behind Jack’s clipped words and brooding countenance.As they hunt down costumes for the annual nativity show and save a donkey from a snowy disaster, Belle can’t ignore their growing attraction. But will a secret from Jack’s past come between them? Or will this finally be the year Belle falls in love?This gorgeous, festive read is like a warm hug in a book! The perfect cosy romance to snuggle up with this Christmas. Fans of Nicola May, Trisha Ashley and Debbie Macomber will love this wonderfully uplifting novel.Readers love Christmas in the Scottish Highlands!‘I loved this book!... a wonderful read… absolutely perfect… it made me laugh, cry and even blush in parts… a fabulous light hearted and heart-warming read, which will get you well and truly in the Christmas spirit by the end of the book! Fab, fab, fab!!’ Stardust Book Reviews, ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐‘Absolutely loved everything about this… I enjoyed this story so much, I couldn’t wait to get to the end… This rapid page turn is a must read, I loved it!... fantastic, heart-warming and exciting… a great festive holiday story… a wonderful must read.’ Page Turners, ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐‘An absolutely stunning read!!! A perfectly gorgeous book!!! The vivid descriptions left me feeling the fresh air of Scotland and feeling the warmth of the fire… make yourself a hot chocolate and clear your schedule ready to get lost in this unputdownable heartwarmer.’ Bookworm86, ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐‘Such a cute Christmas story!... I was obsessed from beginning to end (read it in every single spare second I had)… I would 100% recommend for those who like a good romance in a Christmassy scenario.’NetGalley reviewer, ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐‘This Christmas story is just sooo cute - like OMG someone please make this into a movie. I couldn't get enough of it… It’s just so cute and just the perfect Christmas book escape that everyone needs… So much holiday cheer as well!’ Hammockandread, ⭐⭐⭐⭐‘Absolutely brilliant… a feel-good, heart-warming read… 5 stars from me.’ THE Book Club on FB, ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ Read more

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I enjoyed reading this book! Was exactly the type of book I wanted to read during Christmas. The characters were great. Loved them all. Highly recommend this book!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Wholesome holiday read
reviews.reviewText: This was a cute book we used for December book-club. It was a pretty quick read and not over the top cheesy, though there are some sprinkled in. The characters were likeable, and the story was good enough to keep the reader engaged. For those complaining about the one 'romantic' scene, we're adults here and that is what adults do. There's so much more in the story to focus on.Note: One page in the book came out during reading, no other pages were affected/missing

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 8, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Very good story. When I passed the book along, it went to a small town in Scotland

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars less spice than my mild tacos
reviews.reviewText: Cute little Christmas tale. A little unimaginative. As romance goes… barely Luke warm. Story is slow moving. Characters develop ok—- but the drama is minimal in this way perhaps it was all too neat.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Lovely Read for Any Time of Year!
reviews.reviewText: I read this book in January and it just made Christmas last longer! It was my first book by this author. It won't be my last. The characters just come alive from the pages. You're drawn in immediately into the transformation of Belle, Edina, Jack, Tara, and many others in Christmas Village, Scotland. I will admit every time I read about Bob, the donkey, I imaged him as the donkey in "Shrek." That was another plus.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Wonderful characters that you can care about. A story full of angst to keep you hoping for a happy resolution, and problems galore to block it all from happening! Except for the nasty sex, I loved this book!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Christmas in the Scottish Highlands
reviews.reviewText: Saved this for a Christmas read, but with holiday chores suffocating me didn’t get a chance to pick it up before January. Oh but once I did I could not put it down. If only I could live in such a village. The characters were a hoot and the animals were not to be left out. Gathering to watch a children’s play; helping out a neighbor or two or three; seeing childhood misunderstandings all make this a wonderful holiday read.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Love a story with donkey and kids
reviews.reviewText: Who couldn't love a Christmas story with a donkey, tiaras and a nativity play. Liked the Christmas lists and lessons the characters learned to ask for what you want and two sides to every situation. Anymore of Jack's friend and wife coming?

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 12, 2024

reviews.reviewText: Gemütlich mit einer Tasse Tee im warmen sitzen und das Buch lesen. Die Geschichte ist wunderschön, spannend und weihnachtlich. Perfekt, wenn man gerne Liebesgeschichten ließt. Durch die Detailreiche Beschreivung fühlt es sich an, als wäre man selbst in Schottland. Habe direkt danach den weiteren Teil bestellt.

Thank you to Netgalley and Bookouture for providing the arc of this wonderful Donna Ashcroft book.Holliday loves being at The Christmas village in The Highlands but is there for a reason having lost her partner two years ago.The village is about to be purchased by Damon who it seems may have alterior motives.Another wonderful, funny and charming book by Donna Ashcroft that gives you perfect cosy, Christmas vibes. I'm a huge fan of Donna Ashcroft and her books never let you down.I love that she brings in characters from your favourite books and the way her romances unfold.This book is a slow burn, enemies to lovers + grumpy xsunshine trope. Perfect.I read this as an arc e format and will definitely buy the physical book when it's available.Kerry Kennedy Author
I enjoyed this book, loved the setting n a tiny Scottish village.It was interesting characters with a well thought out storyline.Overall a lovely book
